titleStmt.title: TO THE RIGHT HONOVRABLE SIR Iohn Popham Knight, Lord chiefe Iustice of England, and one of her Maie∣sties most hono∣rable priuie Counsell.
titleStmt.author: Cornwalleys, W.

analytic.title: TO THE RIGHT HONOVRABLE SIR Iohn Popham Knight, Lord chiefe Iustice of England, and one of her Maie∣sties most hono∣rable priuie Counsell.
analytic.author: Cornwalleys, W.

monogr.title: Discourses vpon Seneca the tragedian. By Sir William Cornwalleys, Knight
monogr.author: Cornwallis, William, Sir

div.head: TO THE RIGHT HONOVRABLE SIR Iohn Popham Knight, Lord chiefe Iustice of England, and one of her Maiesties most honorable priuie Counsell.
div.p: HOnorable Sir, since I can truely, let me confidently affirme, this boldnesse proceedes onely from the sight of your vertues; I honour you, and reuerence the executions of your place; I behold not your fortune, but your selfe: and since it is so, be content to accept these and mee, both which offer themselues to you, not for any thing they can, but willingly would do you seruice.

closer.signed: From the honourer of your vertues, W. Cornwalleys.
